summary: The concept of "smart city" encompasses urban areas that leverage digital technologies and data analytics to enhance the quality of life for residents while promoting sustainable development. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, smart cities are integral to achieving objectives outlined in various directives and policies related to construction and town planning. These initiatives aim to foster innovation in urban infrastructure, improve energy efficiency, and enhance public services. The EU supports smart city projects through funding mechanisms and regulatory guidance, facilitating collaboration among local authorities, private stakeholders, and citizens to create resilient and adaptive urban environments.
